subject: Productivity
title: The Pomodoro Technique
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Pomodoro Technique.

hook.text: A struggling Italian student grabbed a tomato-shaped kitchen timer. That timer became a movement.

buildup.text: Francesco Cirillo created the Pomodoro Technique in the late 1980s. Work 25 minutes, rest 5.

discovery.text: The method works by creating urgency. A ticking timer turns vague work into a focused sprint.

twist.text: Neuroscience supports it. Short bursts with breaks prevent mental fatigue and sustain attention.

climax.text: Pomodoro's popularity exploded in the digital age. Dozens of apps now replicate that kitchen timer.

quiz.question: How long is a standard Pomodoro work session?
